since_last_update: US macro growth surprise: ISM Manufacturing printed 52.6 vs 48.5 forecast, pushing the tape toward “re-acceleration / less growth-scare” and biasing the rates channel (higher yields/real yields = valuation headwind for duration, relative support for cyclicals). (LOCAL; confirm via ISM release flow not independently verified here)

Labor-data schedule shock: BLS delayed the January Employment Situation (originally scheduled Fri Feb 6, 2026) due to the partial government shutdown, removing a key Fed-pricing anchor and pushing markets to substitute ADP/claims/speakers (more path-uncertainty; potentially higher vol risk premia). (AP, CBS)

Treasury cash/issuance guidance: Treasury projected privately-held net marketable borrowing of $109B for Apr–Jun 2026 and targeted end-of-June cash balance (TGA) of ~$900B; near-term implication is front-end liquidity sensitivity via bills/repo and cash-drain optics. (US Treasury)

Mega-cap AI concentration risk: Reuters report that OpenAI has been seeking alternatives to some of Nvidia’s latest chips for inference since 2025, adding idiosyncratic downside uncertainty to NVDA/semis and, by extension, NQ via concentration. (Reuters)

Cross-asset vol backdrop: gold and silver rebounded sharply after a violent selloff linked in reporting to the Kevin Warsh Fed-chair nomination narrative and forced deleveraging/margin dynamics; this keeps ‘precious-metals liquidity’ as an active risk factor for broader risk assets. (FT, Barron's)
today_focus: Dominant driver check (today Feb 3, 2026): precious-metals rebound + residual forced-liquidation narrative is likely the clearest cross-asset risk driver (gold up strongly in early coverage), with second-order spillover into USD/real-yield and risk-sentiment. (FT, Barron's, Barron's)

US equities (ES/NQ) likely trading a mixed regime: (1) macro ‘growth better’ impulse from strong ISM manufacturing (rates up = duration headwind) versus (2) idiosyncratic NQ weight pressure from NVDA/semis headlines tied to OpenAI inference chip alternatives. (Reuters, Barron's)

Rates as the transmission rail: watch whether the session is ‘risk-on with yields up’ (cyclicals lead, NQ lags) vs ‘risk-on with yields stable/down’ (broad index support). Treasury guidance on TGA/borrowing adds a front-end liquidity lens into the refunding details. (US Treasury, Reuters)

Shutdown/data reliability premium: with NFP delayed, markets may overreact to second-tier labor proxies (ADP tomorrow; claims Thursday), raising intraday convexity in front-end rates and equity duration. (CBS, AP)

Earnings/micro: premarket movers indicate stock-specific dispersion remains high; index direction may be less informative than factor performance (cyclical vs duration; semis vs rest-of-tech). (Barron's)

market_pricing.dominant_narrative: Cross-asset stabilization after precious-metals deleveraging, with rates repricing (growth-positive ISM) competing against AI-mega-cap concentration risk (NVDA/OpenAI headline).

equities.spx_nasdaq_regime: Likely ‘rates-sensitive risk-on’: ES can hold up better than NQ if yields/real yields are firm; NQ more vulnerable to semis headline concentration even if macro tone improves.
equities.what_market_seems_to_be_pricing: Less growth-scare near-term (via ISM), but not a clean disinflation pivot; elevated sensitivity to liquidity/forced-selling signals (metals) and to mega-cap AI capex/compute narratives.

rates_fx.rates: Front-end and belly expected to be more reactive than usual because the NFP anchor is removed; Treasury’s TGA target keeps bill/repo and cash-drain optics in focus into the refunding details (Feb 4).
rates_fx.usd: Directional bias depends on whether today’s move is ‘risk-on’ (USD mixed) versus ‘rates/real-yields up’ (USD firmer); metals rebound suggests at least a pause in the strongest USD impulse.

gold.what_market_seems_to_be_pricing: A rebound from forced-liquidation and margin dynamics rather than a clean fundamentals-only repricing; volatility premium remains elevated and can transmit to broader risk via liquidity/VAR shocks.

risk_register.risk: Residual forced deleveraging from gold/silver volatility reappears (margin calls / higher margins / liquidity gaps), spilling into equities (esp. high-beta) and credit via VAR-driven de-grossing.
Rates re-acceleration regime: strong ISM keeps upward pressure on yields/real yields, compressing equity duration multiples (NQ vulnerability) even if headline indices look stable.
risk_register.timeframe: This week (into ISM Services / labor proxies)

risk_register.risk: Data-gap / policy uncertainty from shutdown: delayed NFP and other BLS releases raise dispersion in Fed-path expectations; smaller data and speakers can create outsized curve moves.
risk_register.timeframe: This week until funding resumes and BLS reschedules

risk_register.risk: AI concentration/idiosyncratic shock: NVDA sentiment hit from OpenAI inference-chip alternative search broadens into semis/AI complex and drags NQ via index concentration.

Front-end liquidity/cash-drain optics: higher targeted TGA and refunding/issuance details tighten money-market conditions at the margin (bills/repo), indirectly pressuring risk assets if financial conditions re-tighten.
risk_register.timeframe: This week (around Feb 4 refunding details) through quarter

event_warnings: Feb 3: Fed Gov. Bowman speaks (low scheduled impact but higher-than-usual sensitivity given missing NFP anchor). (ForexFactory calendar input)

Feb 4: ADP Employment + ISM Services PMI are the main near-term macro substitutes for the delayed NFP; asymmetric reaction risk if either conflicts with strong ISM Manufacturing. (ForexFactory calendar input)

Feb 4: Treasury to release additional financing details for the Quarterly Refunding at 8:30 a.m.; can shift curve positioning and risk sentiment via issuance mix and cash-balance assumptions. (US Treasury)
Feb 5: Weekly jobless claims become a higher-beta labor signal in the absence of NFP; watch for outsized front-end rates reaction. (ForexFactory calendar input)
